name: Mark of the Demon
description:
The tone of this campaign is dark fantasy and is set around multiple demon lords attempting to assert control over the material world and ultimately enter it.

The adventurers will be marked as the slaves of one demon and must either find a cure, destroy the demon, or attempt to work with it in some way to prevent bringing destruction to the world.

children.name: Fen Fallstar
children.description: A rugged Human Ranger from the forgotten Greycloaks. Hates dark elves.

children.name: Mordan
children.description: A charming Halfling Wizard. Wants to prove himself and be known/respected.

children.name: Ruairih Falvond
children.description: A loyal Dwarf Paladin. Wants to be honourable and help others where he can.

children.name: Skalath
children.description: A slender Iksar Rogue from the sewers of Cabilis. Likes gold.

children.name: Marked
children.description:
Waking up chained to a wall in a dungeon, the group witness 2 humans - one male and one female - sacrificed on an altar.

The group manage to escape and fight their way out, however a large demon crawls out through some sort of rift and curses them before being pulled back into its world.

Another prisoner, a small elf girl around the age of 12, also escapes with them and the group learn her name is Sophea and the two people who were killed were het foster parents.

Taking the girl with them, the group head first to the Lazy Druid Inn to speak to Gregory, then to the Freeport Wizard's Circle where they meet Articus and Belgarath.

Belgarath reveals the curse to be that of a demon's mark, which will slowly ebb away at their sanity until it finally takes control of them.

children.name: Unknown
children.description: A large demon entity roughly 7' tall hunched over, bat like wings spreading from its back and 2 horns protruding from its head.

children.name: Sophea
children.description: An elven-looking girl. Roughly 12 years old and has dark black hair and pale skin.

children.name: Gregory
children.description: A friendly, thick-set man with a dark brown beard. Owner of The Lazy Druid inn and friend to Ruairih.

children.name: Articus
children.description: A stuffy old wizard and bookkeeper at the Freeport Wizard's Circle.

children.name: Belgarath
children.description: An old human wizard. Known and respected across the land for his part in negotiating peace and ending the war.
